column4: call me a n00b, its ok, I am one, but I have a (perhaps stupid) question
whenever I load synaptic, I get this error message:

: Couldn't stat source package list http://.archive.ubuntu.com hoary/universe Packages (/var/lib/apt/lists/.archive.ubuntu.com_ubuntu_dists_hoary_universe_binary-i386_Packages) - stat (2 No such file or directory)
my take on it is that I am failing to connect
what can one do about that sort of thing?
im looking on google for it
the reason i thought it had to do with connection issues was that my machine was really reluctant to connect to the internet
did you refresh synaptic after adding sources?
I'm connecting through a shared connection on a winXP machine
well....maybe not since my connection started working, actually
refresh again and see if that helps
i think that's doing it, it seems to be dl'ing
d'oh, that was rather dumb on my part
its checking the repositories, which was the source of the error before, so yeah, that did it
